description: This trap is used to notify a NMS that a user has updated
the configuration for a given Stm1Oc3 Device entry.

event.Summary: Configuration update on Stm1Oc3 $v2 . Command status: $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ERI-DNX-STM1-OC3-MIB::optDevConfigTrap ERI-DNX-SMC-MIB::trapSequence c 9999 ERI-DNX-STM1-OC3-MIB::optDevCfgAddr a 192.0.2.1 ERI-DNX-STM1-OC3-MIB::optDevCmdStatus i 0

description: A number used to identify the last generated trap
message. This is also included in each Trap PDU
to help allow the NMS to realize if a trap has
variables.name: ERI-DNX-SMC-MIB::trapSequence

description: This number uniquely identifies a STM1/OC3 Device resource.
This number will be used throughout the system to identify
variables.name: ERI-DNX-STM1-OC3-MIB::optDevCfgAddr

description: The command status for this link configuration row/record.
The value used in a SET will be replaced by a response
value in the GET RESPONSE indicating success or failure.
Default Response State used in GET RESPONSE Command
initial default status for a row
Stm1Oc3 Device Cfg Commands used in SET Command (1..99)
Response States used in GET RESPONSE Command (100..199)
Device data has been successfully changed
Stm1Oc3 Device Config Error Codes used in GET RESPONSE Command (400..799)
Au4 sequential mode supports only all-E1 or all-T1 Payloads
Can't configure Device designated as Protection (odd # slot)

variables.name: ERI-DNX-STM1-OC3-MIB::optDevCmdStatus

description: This trap is used to notify a NMS that a user has updated
the configuration for a given Stm1Oc3 T1/E1 Link entry.

event.Summary: Configuration update on Stm1Oc3 link $v2 . Command status: $v3
